author: sky.cactus
content: The SSTORE mutate cost is for DOS protection, not state growth limitation.

author: sky.cactus
content: I think that is generally a good idea.  I think storage writes and base transaction costs are too low, unfortunately.

author: vorot93
content: what are you trying to achieve? it's not like creation of storage is cheap anyway, dapp developers try to avoid it as much as they can to save on gas

author: vorot93
content: by changing _again_ gas schedule you will break dapps with no clear benefit

author: sky.cactus
content: Combined with an increase in gas limit could result in high computational cost dapps being "cheaper".  Though, I would advocate for such a change without a gas limit increase because I personally think the state DB is too big already (I know we disagree on this).

author: vorot93
content: I’m sorry, but state growth being big problem is a myth

author: vorot93
content: And complexifying EVM even more is something I cannot get behind

author: vorot93
content: Except it is because EVM or EVM glue has to support all historical gas schedules

author: vorot93
content: I think a rule that anyone making EVM proposals should first qualify by showing their PRs to existing clients/EVMs would be very useful - need to weed out uninformed so that we don’t spend much time throwing crazy ideas out
